com.spid.android.sdk

Enum SPiDClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<SPiDClient>
      • com.spid.android.sdk.SPiDClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SPiDClient>

    public enum SPiDClient
extends java.lang.Enum<SPiDClient>
    Main class for SPiD, contains a singleton enum INSTANCE. Used for all communication with the SPiD backend

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      INSTANCE

      void apiLogout(SPiDAuthenticationListener listener)

      • configure

      • handleIntent

        public boolean handleIntent(android.net.Uri data,
                            SPiDAuthenticationListener listener)
        Handles incoming Intent if it is sent from SPiD and points to the login page
        Parameters:
        data - Intent data
        listener - The callback listener
        Returns:
        true if Intent was handled otherwise false

      • shouldHandleIntent

        public boolean shouldHandleIntent(java.lang.String appScheme)
        Checks if the Intent should be handled by the SPiD Android SDK
        Parameters:
        appScheme - The appScheme of the intent
        Returns:
        true if appScheme matches the registered appUrlScheme for this app otherwise false

        Returns:
        true if an authentication request is currently running

        public void refreshAccessToken(SPiDAuthenticationListener listener)
        Requests a new access token using the refresh token
        Parameters:

      • apiLogout

        public void apiLogout(SPiDAuthenticationListener listener)
        Logout from SPiD without redirect to browser, therefore any existing cookie will not be removed
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener called on completion or failure, can be null

      • getTokenExpiresAt

        public java.util.Date getTokenExpiresAt()
        Returns:
        Access token expiry date or null if there is no access token

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
        Returns:
        true if the client has an access token that has not expired

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Returns:
        true if the user is logged in and has a user token

      • hasClientToken

        public boolean hasClientToken()
        Returns:
        true if the client has an access token which is a client token

      • hasUserToken

        public boolean hasUserToken()
        Returns:
        true if the client has an access token which is a user token

      • getConfig

        public SPiDConfiguration getConfig()
        Returns the SPiD configuration
        Returns:
        Current SPiD configuration

      • getAccessToken

        public SPiDAccessToken getAccessToken()
        Returns the access token
        Returns:
        The current access token, or null if none exists

      • getCurrentUserId

        public java.lang.String getCurrentUserId()
        Returns the currently logged in user's id
        Returns:
        The currently logged in user's id, or an empty string if no user is logged in

      • setAccessToken

        public void setAccessToken(SPiDAccessToken accessToken)
        Parameters:
        accessToken - access token

      • getAuthenticationListener

        public SPiDAuthenticationListener getAuthenticationListener()
        Returns:
        Authentication listener, if not initialized it will return EmptyAuthenticationListener

      • setAuthenticationListener

        public void setAuthenticationListener(SPiDAuthenticationListener authenticationListener)
        Parameters:
        authenticationListener - Authentication listener, will be set to EmptyAuthenticationListener if null

      • runWaitingRequests

        public java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<?>> runWaitingRequests()
        Runs authenticated requests that have been on hold
        Returns:
        List of futures executed

      • clearAccessTokenAndWaitingRequests

        public void clearAccessTokenAndWaitingRequests()
        Clears current access token and removes all waiting requests

      • clearAccessToken

        public void clearAccessToken()
        Clears current access token for SPiDClient and access token stored in SharedPreferences

      • submitParallelRequest

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> submitParallelRequest(SPiDRunnableRequest request)
        Sends the request to the thread pool to be executed. Requests executed by this method are executed in parallel, there is no way of knowing which request will run first or the order in which they return
        Parameters:
        request - request to execute
        Returns:
        the future of the submitted request

      • submitParallelAuthenticatedRequest

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> submitParallelAuthenticatedRequest(SPiDRunnableRequest request)

        Adds the access token to the request and then executes it if the client is authenticated. If the client is not authenticated the request will be on hold until the client authenticates and then be sent automatically.

        Requests executed by this method are executed in parallel, there is no way of knowing which request will run first or the order in which they return.

        Parameters:
        request - request to execute or null if client is not authenticated
        Returns:
        the future of the submitted request

      • submitSequentialRequest

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> submitSequentialRequest(SPiDRunnableRequest request)
        Executes the request. Requests sent to this method are guaranteed to be executed one at a time in the order they were added
        Parameters:
        request - request to execute
        Returns:
        the future of the submitted request

      • submitSequentialAuthenticatedRequest

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> submitSequentialAuthenticatedRequest(SPiDRunnableRequest request)

        Adds the access token to the request and then executes it if the client is authenticated. If the client is not authenticated the request will be on hold until the client authenticates and then be sent automatically.

        Requests sent to this method are guaranteed to be executed one at a time in the order they were added.
        Parameters:
        request - request to execute or null if client is not authenticated
        Returns:
        the future of the submitted request

      • clearAuthenticationRequest

        public void clearAuthenticationRequest()
        Clears current authentication request
